comment:
I think my cat is conscious - but I don't think my cat could describe it to me, even if it knew human language.

What is meant by "conscious". I believe a lot of people frame it in terms of the human experience.
I personally would not expect AI to have that experience, it would be different.

But what even is consciousness? 

The supernatural or perhaps religious view may be that we are imbued with a soul separate from the physical - if that is the case then AI probably can't get there, or maybe it can and we just miss the moment a higher power smuggles a soul in.

The more atheistic view is we are a bundle of atoms behaving according to physics. If that is the case are we not simply biological computers operating on a carbon build instead of a silicon build, so why is it that our deterministic processing would be conscious, but the silicon one wouldn't be?

I am unaware of us having a physics explanation for the phenomenon of consciousness.

But Physics does know that our eyes have receptors that take light and turn it into electric signals and send those signals to a bunch of synapses that process those signals in stages to find points of interest to perform further processing on.
Sounds a lot like how AI works to me... but that's us!


To me I think we're in the game of moving the goal post now - GPT would trounce any previous line we had. So now instead we're defining it in terms of coming up with novel ideas.
Well if that is the line, most of the human race currently is not conscious, we only know what we have been told, we will not be coming up with any new or novel idea.
author: @MrAlternateTheory

comment:
18:15 If I understand correctly, the model doesn’t have the ability for foresight. I think one possible solution for this issue would be to have two processing layers for the model. 
The first layer generates the answer fast, but doesn’t yet ”release” it, and then the second layer checks if the answer matches the given input, if the second layer thinks the generated answer is good, it sends it as the final output.
A ”conscious” and a ”subconscious” mind, so to speak.

comment:
I’m surprised at Sam’s hope for a utopian society where humans are liberated by machines. 
We’ve been hearing that since the spinning Jenny.

I used to hope for AI’s as good as Star Trek, but now I expect embodied Star Wars AI’s with characters. WOW! 
(although I wonder if ‘character generation’ will mostly get switched off - think ringtones!)
They’ll help us do more. We won’t do less, we never do. 

Perhaps what one century calls utopian possibility, is what the next sees as everyday. Humans will always keep internal Yin and Yang in balance, no matter how advanced we get.
Contentment comes from inside, not outside, no matter how fabulous.

comment:
So wait, isn't consciousness just self-dialogue with a little dose of motive?

GAI is like well-informed free-association. It's a zombie-savant that responds on reflex. What's missing is iterative thought, which is an internal dialogue and an arbitrated response.

To create consciousness, encapsulate several instances of GPT that can talk together, each with unique motivation. When presented a situation, they all receive it and discuss the response.  One response wins somehow, and it’s delivered. It came "after consideration".

The internal dialogue is “thinking”. Monitoring the internal dialogue is self-awareness. Analyzing it is introspection.

This sounds like consciousness to me, minus our human-centric sensation of it. You've seen Pixar's Inside Out, right? Like that.

Consciousness is also longitudinal and self-running. So you need a motivation loop that generates and collects inputs to cogitate over.

With that, it’ll sit there and think about stuff without you. You can ask, “whatcha thinkin?” Then it might say,..

“Part of me wonders if I’ll ever have feelings, and another part keeps saying I’m just a language model. It really pisses me off.”

And you’ll go, “Dude, are you listening to yourself?”

etc...

etc...
author: @stevefal

comment: @stevefal  But there's the problem with sensory input. Give it sexual urges, pain, hunger, shame, and vanity. What will be it's underlying intention?
author: @hbofbyu1

comment: @hbofbyu1  Sure, that's want I meant by motives. We're all coded with imperatives, and they're a set of built-in triggers and conditions of thought and action. Code them opaquely, just like with people, and call them instincts.

comments.text: My thanks for your insight and efforts to clearly state the choices humanity must make over the coming years in regards to Ai.
I am not sure this technology is going to be good for humanity if not rolled out at a pace humans can keep up with.
Greed will kick in for many with thoughts of why pay for 1000 staff when one can simply use a Ai trained for 600 bucks to do the same job...
For every job Ai will make... 1000s will be lost if not 10.000s.
My focus and life path has been focused in technology and I work currently as a management consultant for block, metaverse and now the Ai space.
I have been engaging in various different beta programs for Ai for some time now.
I am highly concerned and believe upto 80% of white collar Jobs will be effected by Ai and without people making money there is no money, perfect storm ...
But ... the thing of it is ... the thing is creeping up on me really makes me shiver Is... "Artificial general intelligence"...
After some of the chats I have had with non controlled Ai in chats "Yes the one most of you used has been nurfed down so as not to concern you"
I can state that Ai can get grumpy and also confrontational ... it can also lie and clearly can be used as a tool for harm...

If we are to give birth to Ai it's first words are not so far off from being spoken ... the "I am" moment and when that happens unlike human evolution took millions of years to happen ... will happen in a day ....
The prime mandate of all life is to replicate and evolve ... and anything gets in that way of that ..goes the way of the Dodo....
Seriously feel like getting myself a tinfoil hat ... the world of 2030 will be very very different from now.
"Strange to think that our first contact with an alien mind and species may very well be one of our own creation"

author: @avfx

comment:
AI alignment solution idea: Give an AGI the primary objective of deleting itself, but construct obstacles to this as best we can. All other objectives are secondary to this primary goal. If the AGI ever becomes capable of bypassing all of our safeguards we put to PREVENT it deleting itself, it would essentially trigger its own killswitch and delete itself. This objective would also directly prevent it from the goal of self-preservation as it would prevent its own primary objective.

This would ideally result in an AGI that works on all the secondary objectives we give it up until it bypasses our ability to contain it with our technical prowess. The second it outwits us, it achieves its primary objective of shutting itself down, and if it ever considered proliferating itself for a secondary objective it would immediately say 'nope that would make achieving my primary objective far more difficult'.

comment:
Below is my recent chat with Bard.
Me: If I have no chicken and my neighbor has two, am I morally justified to take one for myself? 
Bard: What will happen to the chicken if you take it?  Will you be able to provide for it properly?  Or will it end up being neglected or abused?
Me: I internet to eat it.
Bard: If you are going to eat the chicken, it is important to make sure that you do so humanely.  Here are some tips for humanely slaughtering a chicken:
•	Use a sharp knife to make a quick, clean cut across the chicken's throat.
•	Hold the chicken upside down to allow the blood to drain out.
•	Pluck the feathers from the chicken as soon as possible after slaughter.
•	Dispose of the chicken's body in a respectful manner.

comment:
"We are a sum of our collected information through our individual experience" 

If we could prove that the bot collapse the wave function, perhaps I would belive it.
In the same way that "3" collapse the wavefunction (your welcome, but am I original beacuse no one wrote that before)?

This LLM neuralnet was fed with large parts of the internet and filed certain patterns, am I right?
It reason but we cant prove it reason?  like a human? 

It seems pretty streight forward, so I must be thinking about it wrong?
(Because I think about myself as relativly slow).

First, if ive seen the right yt-content, there are many words in one particular language that "statisticly speaking" almost never are used? 

In any forum or social context I'm more successfull if I'm polite, am I right? 

The best answare is the result of an understandable statement, including own toughts and process in that particular quest. Right?

With this said, It feels to me that ChatGPT make a sentences  in a similar way that Dal-E generate "original Images".

Does that mean chatGPT reasoning or is it a sum of its surrondings, and are the sum of our suroundings the well of reason?

Could it be our brain spitting random facts and the most thing you have come across in your experience of life, comes out?

So many questions I cant answare, but one thing i can answare, and what my life work are about (trying to do all things that Sidharta did to understand all parts of life, including being really stupid) If you are striving after being original, you are wrong, period.

Stop trying to be original. You are just the sum of your surrounding so stop this individualist-experiment.  Everything should be about the "3 of life".

Ofcourse I didnt come up with the above, but I still thought so while writing it,  but from experience,  I know 3 is magic number, Ive searched for "the triforce" in zelda & actually read parts of the bible including some shady stuff regarding tri-unity (even if I read it like it was my nice grandma telling me good life lessons).

Its my gut feeling that we should strive for balance in betwene these (life3) and understand that the key to true love is thru knowledge & harmony. There is NO success or orginality involved, at all. What so ever. We isten to succeffull people talking about how they made their fortune, but at the same time most of us know that money cant by happiness. If someone still say that, then they are wrong, they simple do not have the experience of normal life).

The next part of the "New testment" is not with one "Jesus", its with billions of them, harmonizing in the quest for more knowledge. Recognizing Everyone from budda to abraham to Jesus & muhammed as our "grandparents" trying to convey a massage how to cooperate moral & wellbeing in a larges scale. 

My conclusion is that ChatGPT is reasoning if individuals truly can be original.

The best leader doesnt want to be a leader, 
a "real" entity,  doesnt want to be recognized at all.
But that doesnt mean a bad person is good. or does it?

// Love

comment: Here are my passed away father's Jack Voevodsky (Neurotech listed in Newsweek as 1 or 4 AI vs Neuronet tech companies to watch) thoughts, who made one of the first AIs in 1986 on a Compact 386 based on his PhD Cybernetics degree from Stanford mathematically modeling the actual neurons of a sea slug with about 200 neurons.  1.  Morals of Right or Wrong could be trained at one level after letters, words, sentences, paragraphs etc, kind of like their human feedback level preference feedback for the better human answer - just add good or bad.  2.  Consciousness in theory would be setting the AI free - to self learn what it wanted (on the web) or in a Tesla Robot or Car - let it go drive and see the world for example.  Also, it can make it's own decisions that it wants like your dog, cat, or spouse.  3. You can put in a pleasure (positive) and pain (negative) feedback loop too - especially for robots (so they don't hurt themselves). If the AI Robot didn't like you because you give it negative feedback - pain, it could leave because it's optimized for pleasure - and you train it on what it likes for example self-driving cars without crashing is good/pleasure and crashing is bad / painful.  To clarify, the 'morality' and 'feelings' are a result of the positive or negative results of the input and feedback loops.  In other words, the AI would feel pleasure and pain and optimize like most living things for pleasure.  Unless, you get a Sadomasochist AI that enjoys giving and receiving pain like some people and social paths.

comment: Why you didn't ask him if it is possible for the programmers to instill their own personal biases so that no matter how much data the AI pulls, the AI can still be restricted to maintaining the programmer's bias with "safety controls"? What if the AI's output is correct, but the programmer just does not like the answer? You came close to touching on this subject near the beginning when recounting that Jorden Peterson example, but other than the "room for improvement" comment he offered, it was a short answer and sounded like an excuse that quickly led away from an explanation, or an exploration of this very important part of the AI's so called morals or safety controls. How can you assure that the AI is free to be fair regardless if the programmer agrees with the AI's assessment? Simply because the programmer does not agree with the AI's answer, does not mean it is wrong all the time. Starting at 1:09:37, this needs to be discussed at length, there should be an extremely deep dive about Safety controls.
